Package me.dessie.dessielib.resourcepack.assets

Class BlockAsset

java.lang.Object
me.dessie.dessielib.resourcepack.assets.Asset
me.dessie.dessielib.resourcepack.assets.BlockAsset
public class BlockAsset extends Asset
Creates a custom texture and model for a Material block.
See Also:
  • for information on how textures are passed.
  • for how to also use this to replace specific states.

  • Constructor Details

    • BlockAsset

      public BlockAsset(String name, org.bukkit.Material block, @Nullable File modelJson, TextureAsset... textures)
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the asset.
      block - The Material this asset replaces.
      modelJson - A provided default model JSON to use.
      textures - The TextureAssets

    • BlockAsset

      public BlockAsset(String name, org.bukkit.Material block, @Nullable File modelJson, boolean replaceAll, TextureAsset... textures)
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the asset.
      block - The Material this asset replaces.
      modelJson - A provided default model JSON to use.
      replaceAll - If this model replaces all states of this block If this is false, you need to use BlockStateAssets to determine when this model is shown.
      textures - The TextureAssets

    • BlockAsset

      public BlockAsset(String name, org.bukkit.Material block, String replacementName, @Nullable File modelJson, boolean replaceAll, TextureAsset... textures)
      Parameters:
      name - The name of the custom block asset.
      block - The Material this asset replaces
      replacementName - The name within the resource pack. Generally this can be ignored because it can be assumed from the Material. However, in some cases, such as the side of a fence, you'll need to force the name to replace "oak_fence_side".
      modelJson - A provided default model JSON
      replaceAll - If this model replaces all states of this block If this is false, you need to use BlockStateAssets to determine when this model is shown.
      textures - The TextureAssets

  • Method Details

    • setReplaces

      public BlockAsset setReplaces(boolean replaces)
      Sets if this block replaces all of its states or not. If false, you'll need to use BlockStateAssets to choose models.
      Parameters:
      replaces - If the texture replaces all the states.
      Returns:
      The BlockAsset instance.

    • setParentModelType

      public BlockAsset setParentModelType(String parentModelType)
      Sets the parent model type, for example "minecraft:block/fence_post" or "minecraft:block/template_anvil" You may need to look into the vanilla resource pack to view what model type you need.
      Parameters:
      parentModelType - The new parent model type.
      Returns:
      The BlockAsset instance.

    • getParentModel

      public String getParentModel()
      Returns:
      The parent model type.

    • getModel

      public File getModel()
      Returns:
      The model JSON for this asset.

    • getTextures

      public List<TextureAsset> getTextures()
      Returns:
      All the TextureAssets for this block.

    • getBlock

      public org.bukkit.Material getBlock()
      Returns:
      The Material this asset pertains to.

    • getReplacementName

      public String getReplacementName()
      Returns:
      The file name that is used within the resource pack.

    • isReplaces

      public boolean isReplaces()
      Returns:
      If all states are replaced.

    • getResourceBlockModelFolder

      public File getResourceBlockModelFolder()
      Returns:
      The folder that contains the namespaced block model resources. Resolves to serverDir/plugins/pluginName/assets/pluginName/models/block

    • getResourceBlockTextureFolder

      public File getResourceBlockTextureFolder()
      Returns:
      The folder that contains the namespaced block model resources. Resolves to serverDir/plugins/pluginName/assets/pluginName/textures/block

    • getMinecraftBlockModelFolder

      public File getMinecraftBlockModelFolder()
      Returns:
      The folder that contains the minecraft block model resources. Resolves to serverDir/plugins/pluginName/assets/minecraft/models/block
